text: San Fernando is the second largest city of Trinidad and Tobago. About 50,000 people live here. It used to be a borough, but was made into a city in 1988. Pitch Lake is located here. ==Twin towns – sister cities== San Fernando has a sister city, as designated by Sister Cities International: * New Glasgow, Nova Scotia, Canada * La Trinité, Martinique, France ==References== ==Other websites== Category:Cities in the Caribbean Category:Settlements in Trinidad and Tobago
title: San Fernando, Trinidad and Tobago
